newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Kong Tai to place HK$57 mln new shares.
newsitem.headline: Kong Tai to place HK$57 mln new shares.

text.p: Kong Tai International Holdings Co Ltd said on Tuesday it will privately place 130 million new shares, or 8.78 percent of the company's enlarged share capital, with independent investors at HK$0.45 per share to raise a net of HK$57 million.
The placing price represents a discount of about 15.09 percent to the Monday close of HK$0.53, the property concern said in a statement.
Kong Tai said it planned to use 30 percent of the net proceeds to settle the company's mortgage loan, with the rest to be used as additional working capital.
David Wong, chairman and largest shareholder with 315.85 million shares, said he intended to hold his interest in the company as a long-term investment.
